title: @Riot, Will you ever completely re-write the code for LoL?
body: Just a question to any Reds out there. I have heard over the years that the code for LoL is messy, so will there ever be a complete rewrite, or at this point is there too much stuff to completely redo it? I heard that the 2.5 AS cap is in place because of coding limitations, so maybe it could be higher with all new code, along with less random bugs caused during tweaks.

replies.body:
Some of the code's updated or rewritten entirely every patch. Which bits depend on where we think there's the most value (what features should be added, where do we see the most problematic or common bugs, are there ways to make the game run more efficiently etc). 

As far as attack speed goes the cap's not there for code reasons, but gameplay and animation ones. On the gameplay side having a cap allows you to take a maximum into account for balance reasons (what's the absolute max Xin Zhao can reduce his CDs by for example). Animation wise it then gives a range of possible attack speeds that attacks need to be made to look good and feel right for (do attacks remain distinct, feel natural, read clearly etc).
Would that mean you could screw around with the AS cap in a custom game mode like URF if you wanted to?

I'd imagine so, though there'd probably be a bit of code work needed to enable that of course. Odds are some champs wouldn't look at all good above the cap. 

You'd also assumedly want to provide a reason for players to want to get to extremely fast attack speeds. Even if there wasn't a cap right now buying non AS items with Armor Pen, Crit and AD is almost always the better choice than trying to get to 2.5 attacks a second.
Reason to get to extremely high attack speeds: Because gatling laser tentacle vel'koz is awesome. Also: SUPER CARD RAPID FIRE MASTER

>I'd imagine so, though there'd probably be a bit of code work needed to enable that of course. Odds are some champs wouldn't look at all good above the cap.

I can't even begin to imagine the Vel'koz emote spam.

>You'd also assumedly want to provide a reason for players to want to get to extremely fast attack speeds. Even if there wasn't a cap right now buying non AS items with Armor Pen, Crit and AD is almost always the better choice than trying to get to 2.5 attacks a second.

That's kind of why I mentioned something like URF. I'm fairly sure Trist could reach around 2.2 AS just by poping her Q on URF and you still wanted to build a PD/IE to use the stronger crits, allowing champs to break the AS cap might have made auto champs more playable.
This. Building crit on Tristana always makes me feel like I'm going to hit the cap using her Q, as nearly every crit item has AS on it.

Will you be optimizing league with directx12 when Windows 10 comes out? It could give up quite a performance boosts for lower end or old computers/laptops, or add more WOW!!! looking features in the game

speaking of the value of achieving 2.5 atkspd. Does riot have any intentions of making atkspd onhit builds viable? Currently only teemo and kayle can really make the most out of that unique build path, and even then there are just too few onhit items to make 2.5 atkspd truly worth the investment.

From how I understand it they've been going back over the coding little by little every patch. I know a lot of core changes to foundations like Line of Sight mechanics and what not are saved for pre-season patches, as they tend to get really really buggy (inevitably). As far as how far they've gotten with that compared to, say, Hecarim patch (I shudder at those memories :P) I have no idea, but that's the heresay I've come across.

But obviously I'm no red so I could be wrong.
I'd upvote this if riot hired programmers instead of artists... but they don't.
